Add an Expense

  • Docs
  • Guides
  • Getting Started
  • Add an Expense

Expenses are used to add different amounts to categories. They act like a singular document stored in a folder. This is due to the many-to-one relationship between expenses and categories.

This relationship means that one category can have multiple expenses, but each expense can only have one category. In addition to this, you are unable to add expenses until you have created at least one category.

A simplified version of this relationship can be seen on the left.

Ways To Add An Expense

You can add categories in 2 different ways. The first way, option A, is to click the '+' shortcut in the upper-right corner of the Categories section.

Alternatively, using option B, you can click the "Add New Expense" button in the Expense list. By selecting either of these options, a pop-up column will open on the left side. In this column, you can add the desired data for an expense.

Expense Options

To create an expense, you must select the attributed Category, the Name, the Amount, and select the date of the expense

To learn more about each option, select it from the menu below:

The category is the "folder" that the expense is stored in/related to. Each expense can only have a singular category and it cannot be changed at a later date. The associated category name will be displayed in the Expense section as well as the Category Breakdown.
The name is a user-friendly name that will be associated with the expense. The name must be 50 characters or less. This name will be displayed in the Expense section. This setting can be changed at a later date.
The amount is how much the expense cost. The amount must be greater than 0 and less than 99,999,999.99. The amount will be able to be viewed in both the Expense section as well as in the Category Breakdown chart.
The date is the day the expense happened. You can use the date picker to automatically format a given date. However, you are able to manually enter a date in the MM/DD/YYYY format (ie. 03/25/2021 would be March 25th, 2021).

Once this information has been entered, the 'Add Expense' button can be pressed. Please know that when an expense is added or updated, all category-related filters are cleared.
